line.en: It got kind of embarassing, so Yoru-chan and I\ncheerfully put on our clothes.
'...I only intended to get a kiss, but we ended\nup going all the way.'
'...We sure did.'
We sat next to each other on the bed and talked\nwhile staring blankly at the wall.
I wasn't in a complete stupor, but my\nconciousness felt a bit dim.
'...How was it?'
'I should be the one asking... So how was it?'
'It felt warm. Both my heart and body.'
'Same... for me... kinda.'
My heart felt fulfilled from the satisfaction of\nbecoming one with Yoru-chan.
Of course, my body heat from moving intensely\nearlier still hasn't cooled down.
'This is kind of embarassing.'
'...Yeah.'
We glanced at each other's faces and exchanged an\nawkward grin.
I noticed a warm feeling was surging up from\ninside my chest.
Once again, I get a true sense of happiness.
'Sleepy?'
'It's kind of sudden, but.. sleepy...'
'Now that you mention it... Me too...'
We're probably exhausted from sex.
Oh yeah, some time ago, I remember reading\nsomewhere that after sex, you get sleepy.
'You couldn't sleep, right? Isn't now your\nchance?'
'...Fua. I guess so. Then, I'll go... I want to\ntake a shower, but... I'll do it first thing\ntomorrow morning...'
'I'll do that too...'
My fatigue was rising rapidly.
It seemed I might collapse if I let my guard\ndown.
'Anyways, I'll head home to Nee-san.'
'Okay.'
'Well then, I'll be going...'
...Bang!
'Not allowed! It's unfair if it's just\nYoru-chan!'
Asa-chan!?
'Ne-..Nee-san!? Why are you here!?'
Or rather, weren't you sleeping...?
'I-I was listening halfway into the conversation,\nbut having sex without me knowing... That's\nunfair, Yoru-chan!'
'Well, but, it's not like it was a secret...\nThings just ended up this way...'
'Asa-chan, weren't you sleeping?'
'I woke up to go to the bathroom and Yoru-chan\nwasn't there...'
I-I see...
'Anyways, no matter what the reason is, I think\nit's unfair if only Yoru-chan gets to have sex\nwith senpai!'
'So senpai... please have sex with me too!'
'E-... eeh!? Er, that's fine, but... right now?'
'Yes, right now.'
'Right now is... already late at night, and I'm\nsleepy, and exhausted...'
'Since senpai is tired, he doesn't care about me\nanymore?'
'You're going to abandon me and sleep because\nyou're tired?'
'Ne-Nee-san, aren't you exaggerating...?'
'I don't want to be left behind!'
'I think you're overreacting!'
'I want to have sex with senpai!'
Right now...
Right now, can I do it?
I'm tired from doing it earlier so my body feels\nsluggish.
And it's already a good time to sleep. If I have\nsex right now, it'll be a problem tomorrow\nmorning...
'I don't want to be left out... Didn't the three\nof us especially decide to go out together?\nSo...'
'Anyways, you two are unfair! Leaving me aside\nand having sex...'
I guess it's true when she puts it that way.
I'm going out with both of them, so the first\ntime is something important.
Letting myself get carried away and ending it\nsimply without saying anything was something I\nfelt I shouldn't do.
That, and Asa-chan was probably jealous too.
'I-I know that what I'm saying is... a bother,\nbut...'
Asa-chan adds with the usual feeling of\nreservation.
No, this is... certainly...
'I understand, I'm sorry, you're right. Let's do\nit, Asa-chan.'
'Really!?'
'W-will you be okay, senpai?'
'Well, if I do my best... Maybe...'
Though I'm not very confident.
Looks like my whole body's going to be in pain\ntomorrow.
'W-well then, I'll take off my clothes!'
Asa-chan shows a big smile and starts stripping.
Well, I have to work hard from here on out, but\nI'm glad I get to do it.
That day, I recieved both their first times.
I think those days were precious.
The form of our relationship was unique, and may\nbe hard to understand from the outside.
But we were all happy.
The three of us loved each other, and recognized\nour jealousy, affection, and everything else.
There's probably some disapproval with our sort\nof relationship.
'What's wrong with with two-timing, anyways?'
I did a good job of not caring until then, but\nI'd come to question why society nowadays\nwouldn't recognize two-timing.
One day, I'll make society recognize two-timing.\nThat's what I thought.
...Back to the main subject.
Anyways, to me this relationship was something\nwonderful, and naturally, with the activities in\nthe Soaring Club, it was the absolute best.
Something you couldn't buy with money, the\nbrilliant days of youth.
And while living those precious, brilliant\ndays...
The day of our test flight finally came.
'It's about time, huh?'
'Uh-huh.'
Yep, here we go.
We could call this a rematch from last year. A\nchance for revenge.
'This year... we'll show them we can make it!'
'You mean the Morning Glory?'
'Mm.'
That was exactly why I'd been working so hard.
So the first order of business was that we needed\nto have a successful test flight that day.
'Well, this is new...'
Amane hadn't checked it since we had remodeled\nit, so she was rushing over to watch.
'Okay, let's go, Aoi.'
This was the first time I'd flown with Yoru.
Anyway, I was the pilot, but Kotori proposed a\ngame of rock-paper-scissors to see who would get\nto ride in the other seat.
And who would win, but Yoru?
'So, you didn't let her win, I see.'
I said that while looking over toward Asa, who\nwas taking care of the winch along with Kotori.
'Yeah, for some reason, I just thought I would\ntry out winning for once.'
Yoru cracked a wry smile.
Hey, don't worry about it. You know I'll give you\na ride later.
'...You take care of that winch, now.'
'Okay, we're all ready here.'
'Good luck, Aoi.'
Asa and Kotori, the winch operators, waved from\nfar off.
I raised my hand to reply, and then closed the\ncanopy, and immediately began to prepare for\ntakeoff.
'Good luck, Aoi!'
'Yoru too. Fly high, guys...'
'Good luck!'
We took off into the sky with everyone watching.
We took off without a hitch, and whizzed through\nthe air.
The hull stabilized quickly and I switched to\nnatural flight.
But I didn't lose my focus.
I continued with the tests, in that tense state,\nall the while paying close attention to the\ncraft.
'The sky...'
'Yeah. The sky.'
'...It's such a strange feeling, gliding through\nthe sky in something so small.'
'It's not like in an airplane. You feel like the\nsky right there next to you.'
'Yeah. The sky's so close.'
It's almost like you're swimming in a vast ocean,\nthat kind of feeling.
'My sister and the others are way back there on\nthe ground now, huh?'
'Well, that's because we're flying.'
'What's up?'
'Nothing. I mean, right now, they're all looking\nup at us.'
'Did you mean that as some kind of offensive\nremark?'
'No, no. It was more of a sentimental remark.'
'The solitary bird flies high. It does not suffer\nfor company, not even of its own kind.'
'The solitary bird aims its beak to the skies. It\nhas no definite color. It sings very softly.'
'...What was that?'
'They were the words of a Spanish poet, San Juan\nde la Cruz.'
Yoru had said that she liked poetry.
'Now, this glider is a solitary bird. And I'm\nsure someone's looking up at it.'
'If you think about it like that, I feel like you\ncan find a little meaning in flying.'
'...That's difficult. I guess I don't really\nunderstand.'
'What I'm saying is that I'm trying to see the\nvalue in this club.'
Yoru said things like that, almost like a song.
'But you're only assigning that value to it in\nretrospect.'
'...What?'

'Like I said, I like it because I like it. Now,
since you're starting to like the club, you have
to go and define its value in terms of some
theory or something.'
'Maybe that's not it at all, huh?'
'You really are an easily embarrassed person,\nhuh?'
'Eh? Uh, I'm still... me.'
'But of course, I don't hate you for it.'
After that, I repeated the test flight with the\nother members.
I wanted to collect as much data about the glider\nas possible then, to prepare for the production.
'What's up, Asa? Since you came back down, you've\njust been staring into space.'
'She was so impressed she was rendered totally\nspeechless.'
'I see. The sky was over-stimulating.'
Asa was just looking up at the sky blinking her\neyes with an ecstatic expression on her face.
She's been like that from the moment of take\noff... Doesn't look like she's likely to come\nback for a while.
'That's just my sister, she's exaggerating.'
'Yoru, you're in pretty high spirits.'
'She's acting like such a baby.'
'Who's acting like a baby? I mean, provoking me\nlike that. I'd say Aoi's the one acting like a\nbaby.'
'What are you saying?'
'Hey hey...'
'So now everyone's had a turn to ride once,\nright?'
'Seems like it.'
'We really flew a lot today, huh?'
'I want to go up just one more time.'
'Really, you're pretty energetic, aren't you?'
My stomach rumbles.
I really should've eaten the lunch I packed this\nmorning, but apparently my stomach is pretty\nempty.
'Let's go for some lunch when I get back. I'll\ntreat you. Please wait for just one more time.'

When I first got my license, I was taking the
glider out frequently, but now for a while
things've been different. A simulator can only
really give you sort of a feel for the controls.
'Alright. We'll be waiting. 'Cause we know your\nfood is delicious. Watch out for that tailwind\ncoming, huh?'
'It's okay, there's still plenty of time. I want\nto go ahead and do it now.'
I felt like I could recover my skills quicker if\nI went for it now.
I really felt like I could get back my touch from\nearlier on.
'Well then, I'll ride again too.'
'I'm sorry, but I want to take this last run on\nmy own. I just want to try to keep a little more\nfocused...'
'Mmm, alright.'
'Sorry for taking this one for myself.'
'No, that's okay. Good luck. Hey, should I\nprepare the winch?'
'Yeah, please. It's rough being the leader's\nslave, huh?'
'No, no. Give it your best, Aoi.'
So, again I prepared for takeoff, facing the last\ntest flight of the day.
I closed the canopy, held the controls, and\nsignaled Kotori.
I wasn't the least bit nervous.
The aircraft was pulled forward by the massive\nforce of the winch.
And the glider accelerated straight away.
I could hear the sound of the tires inside the\naircraft over all the vibrating and rattling.
I carried out every single step in the takeoff\nprocedures reflexively, without thinking.
'Alright...'
I left the ground and as I increased the angle I\ngained altitude.
Alright, just like so.
I never suspected.
I convinced myself that I could take off\nsuccessfully, even without telling myself, 'Don't\nscrew up.
'Aoi!'
That means I might have been negligent...
Woosh!
'...Wind?'
There was an unexpected gust of wind.
It was a strong tailwind.
With that, I might not be able to guarantee the\naltitude I intended.
But surely it wouldn't lead to this much of a\nproblem.
'Aoi! The cable!'
...BOOM!
In an instant there was an impact like I had\nnever experienced before.
The glider, which should have been climbing, lost\nall its momentum. It was as if I'd come to a stop\nin the sky.
I immediately realized what had happened.
Before I could soar into the sky, the cable had\nto come loose.
And then...
I went into a dive.
I couldn't judge the altitude of the glider, and\nit felt like it was dropping toward the ground.
The aircraft was tilted parallel to the current.\nThe wings grabbed the wind trying to maintain the\nangle, but I wasn't high enough.
I felt my stomach shrinking with anxiety.
Something strange welled up inside of me, and I\nfelt like I might vomit out of fear.
No way, this isn't the time to panic. Winch\ntrouble is just part of flying.
Somehow, I've got to get control of the aircraft!
I'll just immediately shift to a gliding pitch.
But I was still too low, and when I did, I found\nmyself nearing the ground.
'Whoa!'
I pulled back on the controls reflexively.
FOOM!
'Guhrn!'
The craft tilted precariously in a sudden lurch.
I realized that the main wing had hit the ground\nat full momentum.
After contacting the ground, the aircraft bounced\nrepeatedly. My field of vision was shaking, and I\nrealized that I was spinning.
I was looping around on the ground drawing arcs\nin the dirt.
Screeeeeeeech!
After a while, the vibration and spinning\nsubsided.
...Is it over?
I was so relieved. I felt such a sense of\nsecurity, like I'd been saved.
'Aoi!'
I could hear Yoru's voice outside the aircraft.
Seems they were worried and they came running\nafter the glider.
'Aoi...! Aoi...! Answer me, Aoi!'
I could hear her desperately calling me.
But I just didn't have the strength left to\nrespond.
At that point, I lost consciousness.
Why do birds fly?
Well, because they can. Because they can just fly\naway.
They fly because they can fly. When I fly I\nshould become a sign for all the people who can't\nfly.
That's why I can't ignore this way of life.
That's why I have to always be on top.
I have to be noble.
That's why I make the effort. To eliminate\neverything extraneous.
That's why I...
If there was the slightest chance that I would\nchange.. If I just had a chance to touch the\nworld that I couldn't touch before.
I think that was when I abandoned reason, and\nmuch larger emotions began to grow.
Fortunately, I didn't have any serious injuries.
My arms and legs were bruised from the impact of\nthe aircraft hitting the ground. It'll take three\nwhole weeks to recover completely.
I didn't need a cast or crutches, but I had to\nkeep it all well bandaged with ointment, and go\nto the hospital until it was healed.
Also, it was really hard to move my arms and\nlegs.
It was also difficult to get up... That was\nprobably an unconscious way to avoid putting\nstrain on my muscles.
My condition was totally...
'How are you doing, Aoi?'
Yoru came in when I was lying in bed reading\nmanga.
'My body's all black and blue, and it hurts when\nI bend in a weird way, but not that bad.'
'That's great.'
'Yeah. Uh, don't worry about me.'
It didn't really hinder my everyday life in any\nway.
But... Of course, flying was off limits until I\nwas healed.
Well, even if I got a temporary permit from the\ndoctor...
'Really, I'm totally fine. It's just that...'
'Aoi, you don't need to get so worked up about\nit.'
'But! '
But.
It was my fault the main wing was totally\ndestroyed.
Now there was no way we could aim for the Morning\nGlory.
Besides, the glider wasn't the only problem.

Of course, the school faculty knew about the
accident. Tobioka-sensei was furious and had
ordered the Soaring Club to suspend its
activities.
For now the club was temporarily suspended, but\nwhen the opportunity came he would probably crush\nit.
This time, it seemed Akari couldn't protect us.
'...It isn't your fault, Aoi. These two\nunfortunate accidents are just a coincidence...'
'But if I hadn't said that I wanted to fly...'
'I thought about it. What's done is done!'
What if Kotori had been aboard?
...It shook me up just thinking about it.
'Also, I think that this happened because no one\nchecked the cable properly.'
'Problems with the winch aren't that unusual at\nall. There's no reason for every one to worry\nabout it so much.'
'Well, quit blaming yourself then, Aoi!'
'...I'm sorry...'
'...Sorry. But how could I not blame myself?'
It just made me a little more wary of my\nsurroundings.
I'd become desperate. I probably wasn't much to\nlook at at that point.
'...Sorry. I was reflecting back on it.'
'That's good.'
At that point, I hadn't given her any indication\nof how I felt.
I wished I could get rid of the guilt that filled\nmy heart.
'...What about Asa?'
'She's gone to see how the glider is.'
'...I see.'
'...I'm gonna go now, too.'
'What?'
'To the club. If you're feeling so inclined, you\nshould drop by too. And please eat properly.'
With those words, Yoru left.
Club activities, huh.
Club activities that should've already come to an\nend.
'Well, if it isn't Aoi.'
Kotori was there when I went to the dining room.
'You eating?'
'Uh-huh. Since I didn't eat breakfast.'
'Oh, yeah. You made just enough for everyone,\nthen went back to your room.'
'I didn't have an appetite this morning. Sorry.'
'Can you eat now?'
'Yeah. It's like I can't help but eat since I'm\nso hungry. I could hear my stomach growling\nearlier.'
'That's good. C'mon, Aoi, have a seat here.'
'Hm?'
'I'm gonna go get it ready. Patients need their\nrest, right?'
I took a seat at Kotori's request.
Kotori reheated the food I'd made that morning\nand served it to me.
'Thank you.'
'No, no. Every once in a while I have to show my\ngratitude.'
'Gratitude?'
'You worked with us, didn't you? To realize our\ndreams.'
'Last year, when I was such a pain, you took me\nup with you in the glider.'
'Thanks to that, I adopted a much more positive\nattitude. So that's what I meant by gratitude.\nGot it?'
Kotori flashed a bright smile.
'The results were unfortunate, but I'm not\ntotally dissatisfied. No, I'm kidding. I am still\na little frustrated...but.'
'But all of our hard work was worth something, at\nleast I feel like it was.'
'That's why. Don't worry about it. The accident\ntwo days ago couldn't be helped.'
We can live because we're supported by others.\nThis is the kind of thing that affirms that.
There was nothing I could do, so I just shrunk\nback and shut up.
'But I...'
'Aoi, you didn't take away our dream. Rather, you\nwere the one who allowed us to dream.'
'It's only been put on hold for a little while.\nRight? So you didn't do anything wrong.'
I was regaining my strength. I didn't think that\nthere was anything to smile about.
Kotori had been sacrificing her time working\ntogether with us since last year.
She even turned down her friends' invitations and\nworked part-time to save money.
And the dream that we'd been building all this\ntime had now collapsed.
'It's enough. Enough, Aoi. Because I've already\ngotten something really precious out of this.'
'Right? Don't worry about it.'
'...Kotori.'
'Shouldn't we do our best again next year? I\nmean, we have another year left.'
'I can't say what it'll be now, but I'm sure in\nanother year's time we'll amount to something.'
'Yeah, I guess so. I suppose that's good.'
'Yeah, so... It's no problem. We'll still have a\nchance after this summer.'
Uh-oh.
Tears...
If I don't stop it..
I'll cry...
'Well, I'm going back to the room. See ya.'
Kotori leaves the dining room.
Am I depressed? Am I blaming myself? Do I really\nfeel so sorry for everyone?
No, this isn't that kind of feeling.
It's just plain old regret... there's nothing I\ncan do about it.
It's regrettable because it was Kotori.
...This summer...
It's really irreplaceable for us, so y'know, we\ncan't just get it back.
I ate and then went back to my room.
But I had nothing to do, so I was just sitting\nidly.
Just before, Hibari was taking Kotori somewhere.
What about Asa and Yoru...
'The club. If you're feeling so inclined, you\nshould drop by too. And please eat properly.'
She said the club.
There was nothing to do and nothing they could\ndo. Now, there was nothing that we could really\ndo anymore...
I'm gonna go for a walk.
I got dressed and casually went outside, when...
'AOI!'
'Oh, just in time.'
Ageha and Amane came walking up.
'Huh? What are you two up to?'
'We're not really up to much of anything. Today\nwe just came to see how you're doing!'
Ageha came to check up on me yesterday too.
'Thank you for everything you've done. But,\nseriously, you don't need to worry so much about\nme. I'm really fine. Check it out.'
I pranced around a bit to show them.
'Well, even so, you had an accident. There may be\nsome aftereffects, so you've absolutely got to\ntake care of yourself, okay?'
'After something like that, it's only natural to\nworry a little.'
'...I'm really sorry.'
I bowed my head with little hesitation.
'Ahh...You don't need to worry! When you're like\nthat, everybody is going to wonder.'
'Yeah, nothing can be done about the accident .\nRather, I guess we should think of Aoi as the\nvictim.'
She said something similar to what Kotori had\nsaid earlier.
But I had no idea how to respond, and in the end\nI just forced a smile.
'Anyway, you want to go out somewhere, Aoi?'
Amane said that after checking out how I was\ndressed.
Because I looked like I was ready to go out.
'Uh... yeah, sure, I was gonna take a walk. I\nmean, I've just been hanging out in my room, and\nI have some free time, so..'
'Oh.. Well then, can we come too? We've got some\nfree time too!'
'Today's my day off. So if... I mean, if it's\nnot, like, a bother for you...'
The two of them had come to the dorm expressly to\ncheck up on me.
There was no way I should've refused an offer\nfrom the two of them.
But...
'I'm sorry, I was hoping to just go for a walk by\nmyself. I'm really, really sorry.'
'Ageha, I'm sorry. It's just that I want to be\nalone. That's all.'
'Hope you get better soon.'
'...Yeah.'
Somehow, running into Ageha and Amane was a bit\npainful for me.
Because they were friends that I'd worked hard\nwith, together.
I was sorry, and full of remorse, naturally.
So...
I went walking around aimlessly.
Then while I was walking I started to regret.
On that day, why had I tried to fly one more\ntime? Why?
...Again and again, on and on. I was full of\nregret.
I was so eaten away by regret that I felt like I\nwas going crazy.
When I noticed, I was thinking about the time of\nthe accident.
I kept thinking in circles again and again about\nthat time.
It shouldn't have been possible. I thought about\nhow the future would have been if I hadn't chosen\nto fly again that day.
...But even though I thought about it, in the end\nI didn't come up with any answers.
It wasn't constructive.
I understood that.
But...
When I realized it, I'd come here.
Was I aware of what I was doing or not? I, myself\nhave no idea.
All I know is that when I realized it, I'd come\nhere.
...Huh, it's...
'Huh? Aoi?'
Kanako noticed me.
'Kanako...'
'What's up? You came all the way here. You're not\nresting. Are you okay?'
'I'm fine. I've said so many times it wasn't a\nbig deal. More importantly, what about you...'
'I was with those two, but there wasn't much I\ncould do so I came here for some fresh air.'
'Those two?'
'Asa and Yoru.'
Oh.
Apparently, Kanako had been going to club\nactivities.
Club activities.
Even though there was nothing more to do, it\nseems like those two kept the club activities\ngoing.
I guess they're fixing up the glider? Or are they\njust working on a plan for next year's club\nactivities?
'Aoi, are you doing the same?'
'No... I don't think so.'
'Really? Well, then why did you come here?'
'I just...'
I was just taking a walk.
No, that's not right.
Because Yoru said she was coming here.
She said that they were holding club activities.\nThat's why I came.
Even though there's nothing we can do.
But yet, what are they doing anyway?
'Well, you came all this way, you wanna come in?'
'No, but...'
Somehow, it was awkward.
Meeting the two of them. Setting foot in that\nplace again.
That's why I tried to refuse, trying to be\nvigilant.
'It's fine. Come on in, Aoi. So we can see that\nyou're back in action.'
'Action...?'
'Yeah. If they see that, their hearts will fly a\nlittle higher.'
I went in, and Asa and Yoru were there.
Yoru was facing a desk doing something with some\nkind of notes spread out in front of her.
'Ahh! It's Aoi!'
'Uhhh...'
They both noticed me.
'Aoi, you came.'
'...Mmm. Yeah, y'know, I was just in the\nneighborhood, so...'
It was a strange lie, but then again, it wasn't\ncompletely untrue.
'So, what are you guys up to?'
'Club activities.'
'Well, you can call it that, but...'
The glider was already broken.
It was way too late to rebuild the glider now,\nand it was impossible financially.
'You're getting ready for next year? I see. Yeah,\nI guess so. I'm not sure if the club will be able\nto continue, but maybe next year...'
'What are you talking about, Aoi? It's for this\nyear.'
'...What?'
'Didn't you say we should see the Morning Glory?'
'Well, okay, but what about the glider?'
'If it's broken, then we'll just have to fix it.'
Yoru just said that like it was nothing.
'No, no, no. There isn't the money or the time\nto...'
'It's okay, our family is rich. I'm sure we can\ntake care of it.'
'Well, even supposing that that wasn't a problem,\nwhat about the time it takes...'
'Yoru thinks that we can do it if we modify the\ndesign of the frame a bit.'
'...What?'

'I don't really understand entirely, but she says
if we use cloth, we can get our grandfather to
help, and we should be able to complete it just
in time.'
'Cloth?'

'It's a wing structure with cloth stretched over
a steel frame. The performance isn't quite on par
with the FRP wing, and there's no weight
tolerance, but I'm going to think about that more
later...'
'We make a frame from wood and steel pipe, then\nwe stretch the cloth over it. If we do it this\nway, we should be able to complete it in time.'
'Fortunately, the base of the glider wasn't\nbroken. It was pretty gaudy, but after the\nrepairs it seems to be okay.'
'In addition to the various materials we need to\nprocure, I couldn't design it all by myself, so I\nenlisted some help from home.'
'Can you do that...?'
Help from their family?
Turns out her parents are researchers.
Her grandfather's the chairman of the school and\nhe's sponsoring the windmills on the hills over\nthere.
'I don't know yet, but I think it would be\nworthwhile to ask him and see.'
'I had to take a fresh look at it to see what we\nwould need for the process.'
'But why... Why are you so...'
'Because you guys didn't have any sympathy.'

'It's still way too early to give up. Of course,
the glider is broken. If you think about it
normally, you might say it's impossible. But...
I'm not normal.'
'I'm a genius with money.'
And strong. She was that kind of person.
It's true that Yoru was a little abnormal.

'Luckily, my family's good with this kind of
technology and with piping. Because they're in
the business and they conduct research. That's
why I think we should use them.'
'But, but.. Would they do that kind of thing just\nfor some students' club activities?'
'But even so, Aoi, are you trying to make fun of\nthis project that I've been pouring myself into\nhere?'
Yeah. I guess I was.
Now, I'm kind of at a loss of words.
About myself, about everyone else, and about this\nclub.
'It's really a shame. I felt like I was really\nchanging a little thanks to you...'
'I'm aware of so many things now that I was never\naware of before.'
'I've changed. I really have. My selfish heart\nhas changed. And yet...'
'Just because you had some little failure, now\neveryone is just supposed to just give up?'
'Don't you think that's a shame?! It's a shame!\nAt least for me, it is!'
'I know it's probably pointless. After doing all\nthis, I'm probably not going to get anything out\nof it. I won't be commended by anyone.'
'But..! But..! I'm so disappointed. Somehow, I\ndon't understand...'
'I don't want to give up on this summer.'
Yoru said something like that with a passion and\nintensity that I couldn't even imagine her being\ncapable of normally.
Normally, she was cool and indifferent, and had\nno interest at all in club activities.
That's how her character was supposed to be\nbefore, but now Yoru had changed.
I felt the heat.
It was the same as a long time ago when I was so\nfocused on my bike - or even last week, I guess\nI'd been just as focused on the glider.
'...I think so, too. Because after all this, the\nsky's almost within our reach. If there's any way\nwhatsoever, I'm ready to keep trying.'
'Well, for now, this is it. This is definitely\nit. This is my dream. This is my hope. This club.\nThis is your dream.'
'So, will you still let me dream a little with\nyou?'
'So, am I going out with two people, or what?'
Yeah. Yeah, definitely.
Why was I ready to just give up so easily?
We still have time. And our chances are better\nthan nothing.
And since they are...
'...Yeah, I know. It's true.'
'Sorry. I'm going to help too. Like I said, my\ninjuries aren't quite healed yet... But...'
I think there may actually be a way.
If a Morning Glory develops slower than usual, we\nmay be able to aim for it.
That kind of miracle just might happen. So...
'Just as I suspected, Aoi. You understand now\nthat we talked about it.'
'I was pretty depressed for a couple of days. I\njust thought it was impossible, but anyway...\nSorry. You're right, we can keep trying.'
'If my lovely girlfriend tells me that she's\ngonna keep trying, I would be lying if I said I\nwasn't going to.'
'Ah ha ha!'
'That's right, Aoi. You're my boyfriend, so at\ntimes like these you have to play nice.'
'Yeah. I guess so.'
I was determined, and my fire had been lit.
The summer wasn't over yet.
It wasn't a time for regrets.

'So, for the time being, we can check to see
whether it's possible or not. Aoi, since I've
gone through all this trouble, you can come along
too.'
'Uh, where?'
'To our house.'
I say bye to Kanako and leave to visit Yoru and\nAsa's family's house.
Anyway, since it was just us, I would accompany\nthem as a senior member of the Soaring Club.
To get to their house, we went two stations from\nthe school by train, and then from the station it\nwas another fifteen minutes by bus.
It was very different from the homes of average\npeople, and I gathered that the two of them used\nto live there.
The two of them guided me along a wooden walkway\noverlooking a landscaped garden, which led toward\ntheir grandfather's room.
'This house is amazing.'
'Because our family is rich.'
They were clearly incredibly rich.
'You live here with your family?'
'Well, we live at Flying Fish Manor now, but\nbefore, yeah, we lived here... And there's also\nthe live-in help.'
The place where the two of them used to live was\nlike a different world to me.
'Our parents haven't come back in a long time.'
'...What?'
'They're kind of obsessed with their jobs and the\nresearch. They're workaholics.'
'They didn't even come back on our birthday...'
'Oh, I see...'

It seemed for a moment like I'd touched on a
really sensitive subject, so I was a little
worried at first, but I guess it wasn't such a
big deal.

'People often tell me I'm like my parents. But,
I'm very different. I'm not the kind of person
who gets really wound up in one thing and loses
sight of the world around me.'
'People often tell me I'm not like either of\nthem.'
'Oh, I see...'
Somehow, I felt like I grasped the situation.
'I don't want to become that kind of adult. Even\nwhen Mom was pregnant with us, the two of them\nwould spend nights in the laboratory.'
'That's pretty harsh, huh?'
'Isn't it, though?'
'When Mom and Dad are free from their work,\nthey're super nice.'
'I know at times they were really loving. It's\njust that it's clear that work is their highest\npriority.'
'Aahahaha...'
Well, researchers have a reputation for being\nweird.
I suppose they're just that kind of person, yeah.
'So, where are we going now?'
'To my grandfather's place. To ask for help, and\nto...'
'He might be able to do something about club\nactivities being suspended.'
'Oh, I see.'
Tobioka-sensei had ordered us to suspend the\nSoaring Club activities.
I'd forgotten all about it, since we'd been\ntalking about being able to repair the glider,\nbut we still had to deal with it.
'We could ask the chairman, but it's definitely\nnot an ideal way to resolve things.'

'Why are you talking about that now, Aoi? There's
no point if we can't fix the glider first. We
need it to fly the risky skies in the first
place.'
'You're always acting like such a spoiled brat.'
'...Yeah, I know.'
'Aren't we trying to fly just for the sake of\nappearances?'
'Oh?'
That was true. It wasn't like we were flying\nbecause we wanted to do something really noble.
'Being selfish is my forte. I can be useful.'
'Right now, I'm not sure exactly what kind of\npower you'll provide, but you've sure got lots of\nheart.'
'Ehehe.'
The two of them led me onwards, and eventually we\narrived at a big room.
And just as we did...
'You're here, Yoru, Asa, and...'
'You're Minase-san's son, aren't you?'
'...What?'
At Yoru and Asa's invitation, I entered a really\nspacious Japanese-style tatami room.
This stern old man had been enshrined here.
'Nice to meet you, Aoi Minase.'
'Yes, sir. Nice to meet you, too.'
I'd been caught off guard, and I answered in a\nbit of a panic.
He's the school chairman... How does he know my\nname, anyway...?
And Minase-san...?
'Hahahaha! You look just like your mother!'
Oh, really.
'He was introduced to her when he hosted a\nmeeting with some of his old acquaintances here.'
'So, my mother and your grandfather are\nacquaintances.'
'Speaking of which, I guess he knows her face.'
'She was mature, dependable, and a positive\nperson.'
'You seem to be that kind of fellow, too. You've\ngot strong eyes.'
'Well, thank you very much.'
The chairman was complimenting me.
I felt a little uncomfortable...
'So, folks, let's see. The issue at hand here is\nthat you want some help repairing the glider you\nuse for your club activities.'
'Yes. We were hoping we might be able to get our\ndear ol' Grandpa to help us out.'
The two of them said before that they talked with\ntheir grandfather often.
I guess that's why he seemed to understand\neverything about the situation.
'Please, Grandpa. We're not going to be able to\nfulfill this dream that we have!'
Asa made a compelling argument.

Usually, Asa lacks self-confidence, and just goes
along with other people. But she was selfish, and
she could be thoroughly stubborn when she had to
be.
Her plea was full of ambition and she's\nincredibly tenacious.

'When he was talking on the phone, he said he
won't give us any financial assistance,
materials, or professional consultation for the
designs.'
'There may not be much, but maybe I can get an\nadvance on my allowance.'
'Yeah, mine too. Then, if we don't have enough,\nwe can get part-time jobs later.'
The two of them were willing to do that much.
Regardless of the fact that they hadn't been in\nthe club for long, they still talked like that.
'It might be considered bad form to borrow money\nat someone else's home, but I'll pitch in, too.'
This wasn't the time for me to keep my mouth\nshut.
'Actually, I was the one who broke the glider in\nthe accident... It would be such a shame for\neverything to end like this.'
'So, if something like that could be possible, I\nwould really appreciate it.'
'C'mon, Aoi, you don't have to try to do the\nimpossible.'
'It's not impossible. That's pretty lame, isn't\nit? Asking for money from girls.'
'Okay, let's band together, and all three of us\ncan pitch in.'
We had no reason for regret.
We had no idea what might happen next year, so it\nwas important that we were all together this\nsummer.
'First, one question, Asa.'
'Yes.'
'...Why do you want it so bad?'
'You mean, what's my motivation?'
'Your purpose. The reason you yearn for the sky.\nI don't understand it at all, and I see no\ncompelling reason to help you out with this.'
'Aiming for the sky is dangerous. When people\nfall from high places, they die. I'm sure you're\nwell aware of this.'
'It isn't honorable. It isn't lucrative. So why,\nthen, do you want to fly?'
It was similar to the question he'd asked Yoru\nbefore.
Why do you fly?
'For me, it's because I feel like if I can fly,\nthen that can help support someone.'
'At first, I just had some vague yearning for the\nsky, but now that's how I feel.'
'That's... Maybe it's because I'm a being\ncompletely unrelated to the sky... I think that's\nwhy...'
'Because I can't fly, that's why I want to fly.'
In some way, Asa's words were earnest and\npoignant.
It was so like her. She was a real straight\ntalker...
And then...
'What about you, Yoru?'
'...Because I like it. I'm drawn to it. I don't\nhave any reason apart from that.'
They were the same words that I'd spoken to her\nthe other day.
Because I like it.
There was nothing more to say, anything you could\nadd to that would just be tacked on,\nextraneous...
'Unlike Asa, I'm nowhere near ready to try it out\nmyself. My heart isn't drawn up to the heights.'
'But I think that's precisely why the vague\npurpose of meaningless flying can stir one's\nheart like few other things.'
'...Flying without any reason?'
'Yes. To me, chatting with friends seems\nworthless. I do feel that it's superfluous to do\nthings that aren't honorable or lucrative.'
'But that's why...'
'That's why I want to fly, because I feel like\nit. I guess maybe it's just because I love it.'
'Well, that was a rambling, incoherent answer.'
'Grandpa, honestly, I really don't know why\nmyself. I don't know why I've become so\npassionate about this club.'
'But maybe, that love is something that my senpai\nover there taught me.'
My eyes met Yoru's.
'I feel that way, too. I really, really love it.\nI came to love it. I love our club.'
'I don't understand it. It's something I love,\nbut don't understand.'
Something you love and don't understand.
Something unreasonable.
Something meaningless.
Flying is precisely that kind of ambiguous thing.
So that's why, Yoru...
'Hahahaha! You and these youngsters are worried\nthat you don't know so much, but that's no reason\nto worry!'
'...What?'
'Nothing Gold Can Stay.'

'That's the best kind of experience for a
damnable little girl like yourself. That fire
that you feel here will become a valuable source
of information, Yoru.'
'Uh, you mean...?'

'It's good to look within yourself, but on
occasion it's also good to be out in the open
air. I guess it's because you're a person who
stands above other people.'

'That fire's something that you can only
experience in your youth, a finite expression of
passion. People make it their driving force. In
retrospect, I guess they always will.'
'Yoru, you're a bird that people envy. You aim\nhigher than anyone else.'

'But don't get caught up in being a bird. You've
got to come down to the ground sometimes. Try
walking. There are some views that can only be
seen from this vantage point.'
'...I hope you'll have a look.'
'Well then!'
'...Bwahahaha! I guess no matter how you live, if\nyour luck turns sour, you die! And if you die,\nthen that's it, girl. That's all there is to it.'
'Necessary risks should be shouldered. You try to\nprepare all the materials and human resources.'
'Grandpa...!'
'Weren't your club activities also suspended? I\nmight have to apply some pressure to get that\nlifted, too.'
'If you go parading around doing too much, people\nmight start spreading some nasty rumors.'
'But before you know what happened, school life\nis... It should be fine without worrying about it\ntoo much, though.'
'Sure. Being the adult that I am, I'm going to\nteach you children something.'
'Power and money exist to be used. And if it's\nfor the sake of some kids, even better.'
P-powerful...!
'Back when I was young, I used to fly a glider\ntoo, so I understand. I was entranced by the\nsky.'
'Really?!'
I didn't expect to hear that.
His past was...
'That's news to me!'
'You know, that place that you kids are using for\nyour activities now, that's the same place our\nSoaring Circle used way back then.'
'...I guess that's why all the tools and\nequipment were still there.'

'I've been hiding something. I met Minase-san
there actually. I was an alumnus and Minase-san
was a circle member, it was that kind of
relationship.'
'Well, everybody ended up getting busy, and the\nclub disbanded, but that's just how it was.'
It seemed almost like divine providence.
My mother, and Asa and Yoru's grandfather, had\naimed for the sky, the same as us.

'The knowledge we gained then, we later put to
good use in our research. That's something you
should realize, Yoru. In this life there is no
such thing as a useless experience.'

'You're just a little too clever, and as a result
you have tunnel vision. Changing one's values can
be the impetus for producing new concepts. You
should bear that in mind.'
'Last year you kids probably would've never\nsuspected that you'd become so immersed and\naddicted to flying.'
'Grandpa, that's...!'
'Oh, that, huh? It was a secret. Sorry, sorry.'
'Huh? What is it?'
'...Don't worry about it.'
'So, Minase...'
'Take good care of these two. My incompetent\ngrandkids, I mean...'
'Wh-what?!'
Could it be that he knew about us!?
But both of them... Could that mean...!
'Huh? Why are you so surprised? I mean, you're\ngoing to have to take care of the club\nactivities, aren't you?'
'Oh, uh, yes sir!'
Oh, now I see...!
I was the one who had misunderstood.
'Oh?'
'...Hmmm? Why, is there anything else I should\nknow about?'
'N-.. no! Nothing!'
'Nothing at all!'
'...Right.'
'...Something's a little odd here.'
'N-.. no, I don't think so!'
'No, nothing! Nothing at all, Grandpa!'
'Um, really!'
'Well, that's your business. I'm not going to say\nanything at all about it.'

'Because I suppose you must know that there's no
way I could forgive you if you were doing
something deviant that might upset my
granddaughters!'
'Yes, uh, yes sir! Nothing like that, for sure.'
'(stare)...'
'A-.. Aahahaha...'
Um, let me see here.
Maybe, he has some idea?

After that, we went back to the dorm and bathed,
had our dinner, and changed into our uniforms.
Then after we dropped by the school, we went to
the secret base again.
We went to reassess the damage to each part of\nthe glider, and determine what materials and\nsetup would be required.
And for that reason, we secretly borrowed some\nspecial equipment from the school.
Thanks to the key card the school chairman had\nentrusted to the girls, we were able to carry out\neverything smoothly.
By the way, we didn't tell Kotori about this.

Normally we would have told her, but this was an
arrangement that the chairman had suggested we
try out, so we couldn't really be sure whether it
would work or not.
It was just a slim chance, and it was highly\nlikely that it would prove completely impossible.
And in any event, the requirements were too\nurgent. There wasn't enough time until the day\nthat the Morning Glory would probably come.

We needed to fix it within three days if
possible, or within one week at the absolute
latest, so it was a situation that demanded
extreme selfishness.
The situation being what it was, we didn't want\nto make them too excited.
So, that meant that until this point it was still\nfor our eyes only.
Since we'll be able to come up with a reply\ntomorrow, then as soon as we do...
'I think we can repair this part by ourselves.'
'Yeah, I guess so.'
There are likely to be some parts that we can\nquickly take care of ourselves. We can check\nthat, too.
We need to be on standby so we can start work\nimmediately if we get the green light.
'Zzzzz...'
'Asa fell asleep again.'
'Today was really tiring for me, too. We did a\nlot.'
'Yeah, I guess so. I think she was really worried\nwhen you weren't doing so well.'
'What?'
'She was really depressed when you were out of\nsorts. Just as badly as when the glider was\nwrecked.'
'So, I think she was really relieved when you got\nbetter. I guess it's still pretty early.'
'Oh, yeah. I never even got a chance to thank\nher.'
To say thanks for caring.
'Yeah, I guess so. I think we're good for now. We\ncan finish up here.'
'So, is this the end?'
'Yes. This is it.. Now, we'll just have to wait\nfor my grandfather's reply.'
'Why is it that even though we don't know yet, I\nstill feel like everything'll be fine?'
'Me too. Ironic, huh?'
'I don't really have much confidence in the\nexistence of God, but in times like this you feel\nlike he sets your mind straight.'
'Yeah, I feel like that.'
'The god of the sky is definitely watching over\nus.'
'Yeah. I guess so.'
Probably, for sure, yeah.
Somehow it felt like it.
'Now, I'm sure. At this point, this has become an\nunforgettable summer.'
'I think I'll always remember this every year\nwhen summertime rolls around. This summer. I feel\nlike that for some reason.'
'And these memories will become the fire that\nshapes you.'
'Look, don't windmills spin because they receive\nthe wind? With it, they produce energy. Then the\nenergy moves other things.'
'The fire that you've been storing up will give\nyou energy to move yourself in the future.'
'Aoi, don't go rattling off that super-cheesy\nstuff anymore, please! You're so weird!'
'Yeah, maybe so...'
'I'm going to call you the natural poet.'
'Ha! I'm a poet and I didn't even know it.'
'Actually, wasn't it you who blew the wind that\ncreated these feelings?'
'Yeah, maybe...'
'That's right. Because of you... my personality\nseems to have changed...'
'Take responsibility for it.'
'Responsibility...'
I wonder how I should take it.
There's no way I can take it.
Yoru's cheeks were stained deep red and she was\npeering up at me.
At a time like this...
I moved closer and embraced her.
'...Nee-san is... sleeping close by.'
'But... I can't stop myself.'
'If she wakes up, we can let her join us.'
'...Quite a vulgar thought. But...'
'I don't hate this side of senpai, either.'
